snippet: The Ukrainian government on Sunday for the first time sent in its security services to confront armed pro-Russian militants who took over a police station in the country’s east, Ukrainian officials said.
abstract: Ukrainian government sends security forces to confront pro-Russian militants in country's east, defying warnings from Russia and using force for first time during crisis; commandos engage in gunfights with men who had set up roadblocks and captured a police station, resulting in several injuries and at least one death; push to reassert authority appears largely unsuccessful, with protesters retaining significant control in area.

byline.original: By ANDREW E. KRAMER and ANDREW HIGGINS
byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer reported from Slovyansk, and Andrew Higgins from Kiev, Ukraine. Reporting was contributed by David M. Herszenhorn from Moscow, Somini Sengupta from New York, and Brian Knowlton and Michael R. Gordon from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Ukrainian government on Sunday for the first time sent in its security services to confront armed pro-Russian militants who took over a police station in the country’s east, Ukrainian officials said.

headline.main: Ukraine Forces Storm a Town, Defying Russia
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Forces Storm a Town, Defying Russia
